additional_steps.description: Supernatant removed to a round-bottom flask for crystallization by slow evaporation at room temperature.

characterization_methods.details: Powder and single-crystal X-ray diffraction measurements performed at room temperature using a Rigaku 2000 diffractometer with Cu Kα1 radiation (λ=1.5406 Å).
Measured with a superconducting quantum interference device magnetometer (Quantum Design MPMS).
Measured with an Andeen Hagerling 2700 capacitance bridge in a Cryogen-free Superconducting Magnet System (Oxford Instruments, TeslatronPT) with a home-made probe.

Measured by using a 6517B electrometer. Sample was poled in a positive or negative electric field of 5.4 kV/cm from 180 to 2 K. After removing the poling electric field and releasing space charges for 30 minutes, the pyroelectric current was recorded with warming at a constant rate of 2 k/min.
